column5: I am not sure if this will be good or bad for the fishery.http://www.durhamregion.com/news-story/6995763-lake-dredging-project-gets-conditional-approval-from-scugog/
They are only delaying the inevitable , Scugog is in the final stages of lake succession .

Sounds good to me. I think that Scugog needs all the help it can get. The creation of wetlands to filter storm water before it enters the lake can only be a good thing. Although a very small project ( footprint wise ), every bit will help. Im sure Ducks Unlimited will be all over it.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lake_Scugog  Not a very deep lake for up north? Some dredging may help?

for the area that they are going to Dredge I think its a excellent idea.  that section of the lake is very shallow and during the summer months its just a pile of sloppy algae.   Deepening certain parts of the lake would be great and hopefully lessen the lake of some of the choking algae during June-July.
It's good for the people that will use that area.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lake_Scugog  Not a very deep lake for up north? Some dredging may help?  Yeah, it's pretty shallow.  But, it's actually down south for many of the members hear.  I guess it's all relative.

Yeah, it's pretty shallow.  But, it's actually down south for many of the members hear.  I guess it's all relative.  LOL, true John, your province dwarfs most of our states, something I keep forgetting.
